1.1.section: 1. Data description and collection or re-use of existing data
1.1.question: How will new data be collected or produced and/or how will existing data be re-used?

1.2.section: 1. Data description and collection or re-use of existing data
1.2.question: What data (for example the types, formats, and volumes) will be collected or produced?

2.1.question: What metadata and documentation (for example methodology or data collection and way of organising data) will accompany data?

2.2.question: What data quality control measures will be used?

3.1.section: 3. Storage and backup during the research process
3.1.question: How will data and metadata be stored and backed up during the research process?

3.2.section: 3. Storage and backup during the research process
3.2.question: How will data security and protection of sensitive data be taken care of during the research?

4.1.question: If personal data are processed, how will compliance with legislation on personal data and on data security be ensured?

4.2.question: How will other legal issues, such as intelectual property rights and ownership, be managed? What legislation is applicable?

5.1.question: How and when will data be shared? Are there possible restrictions to data sharing or embargo reasons?

5.2.question: How will data for preservation be selected, and where will data be preserved long-term (for example a data repository or archive)?

5.3.question: What methods or software tools will be needed to access and use the data?

5.4.question: How will the application of a unique and persistent identifier (such us a Digital Object Identifier (DOI)) to each data set be ensured?

6.1.question: Who (for example role, position, and institution) will be responsible for data management (i.e the data steward)?

6.2.question: What resources (for example financial and time) will be dedicated to data management and ensuring the data will be FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Re-usable)?

_unconnected_text.text: Plan we wniosku

The main data consists of sustainability disclosures included in Airline companies’ annual disclosures. This information is public and found on companies’ webpages.

The first phase of the project is interested in the sustainability indicators disclosed in reports. The indicators will be coded and entered a statistical analysis software (SPSS). The indicators as such will be treated as variables whose frequencies will be under scrutiny. 

The second part of the project will use critical discourse analysis to analyze the sustainability-related phrases in a sample of the reports.

The literature in this study's literature review has been gathered through electronic databases such as Scopus and WoS. The primary investigator (PI) intends also to update the literature review before each dissemination of results by conduct a more in-depth review of past research on sustainability reporting in the
airline industry by using a systematic literature review approach.
Wykonanie
Numerical data associated with the first phase was first entered into Excel. Data subject to statistical analysis requiring SPSS was imported into SPSS from Excel. Otherwise, no changes were made.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku

Numerical data was entered into Excel for preliminary cleaning and analysis, rather than directly into SPSS as planned. Only data requiring more complex statistical analysis was imported into SPSS. This approach improved data preparation and accuracy while aligning with analysis needs.

Numerical data was entered into Excel for preliminary cleaning and analysis, rather than directly into SPSS as planned. Only data requiring more complex statistical analysis was imported into SPSS. This approach improved data preparation and accuracy while aligning with analysis needs.
Plan we wniosku

The data for analysis is extracted from Airline companies' annually published disclosures. All reports are expected to be available in PDF format. (all reports are expected to be available in the 1st half of 2020)

The number of estimated reports will be between 200-300 reports. (ranging from 20 pages to 100 pages)

The number of documents downloaded from the Internet and stored for a literature review is approx. 250 articles or other equivalent documents

The size of the estimated data is approx. 4000-5000MB

Coded data will be transferred to SPSS (. sav) and Nvivo (. nvp).

The electronic literature will also be saved in Mendeley
Wykonanie
Numeric data was initially saved in xlsx. Otherwise, no changes were made.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Numerical data was entered into Excel. See justification in Section 1.1
Numerical data was entered into Excel. See justification in Section 1.1
Plan we wniosku

Airline annual disclosures will be collected from Airlines’ webpages in PDF. Sustainability indicators will be identified from the disclosures. Indicators following GRI codes will be entered SPSS. Indicators in other reports will be identified manually. NVivo may be brought into use to facilitate the coding process. All data will be entered SPSS manually for statistical analysis. A sample of reports will be analyzed using Critical Discourse Analysis.

All data will be stored under a logical folder structure consisting of folders for literature, Airline disclosures, SPSS, NVivo, and thesis (Word). All working files will be versioned by date. Each folder has an archive folder to which all old files will be saved.

Selected data will be facilitated by open research data repository (Bridge of Data by Gdańsk University of Technology) with metadata standards such as DataCite. Metadata description will be stored in JSON-LD format. Author will be identified and authorized by ORCID number
Wykonanie

Numerical data from the first phase was initially entered into Excel. Data requiring statistical analysis was imported from Excel into SPSS.

As intended, selected data has been stored in Bridge of Data, containing information related to published research. How data for preservation was selected is rationalised in Section 5.2. 

Otherwise, there have been no changes.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Numerical data was entered into Excel. See justification in Section 1.1
Numerical data was entered into Excel. See justification in Section 1.1
Plan we wniosku

An in-depth evaluation of previous literature is be conducted using a systematic literature review (SLR) approach. An update to SLR will be made before any dissemination work. The protocol for SLR is in line with previous other SLR protocols used in management studies. Protocol creation and exclusion criteria have
been assisted by the research mentor.

All entries of data from airline reports to SPSS will be double-checked. All working documents will be versioned on a regular basis and saved on a computer and external hard drive.
Wykonanie

The SLR was not updated after every dissemination of project results.
Microsoft OneDrive and Google Drive were also used for storing data. 
Otherwise, there have been no changes.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku

The SLR was not updated after every dissemination of project results; however, an updated SLR was published as a separate journal article (Zieba and Johansson, 2022). The PI received automatic updates from Web of Science based on the search string used in the original SLR, indicating minimal evolution in the literature on airline SR. This suggests that frequent updates were less critical.

Following a reviewer’s recommendation to use a shared drive, both Microsoft OneDrive and Google Drive were also employed for data storage and sharing of working files.

The SLR was not updated after every dissemination of project results; however, an updated SLR was published as a separate journal article (Zieba and Johansson, 2022). The PI received automatic updates from Web of Science based on the search string used in the original SLR, indicating minimal evolution in the literature on airline SR. This suggests that frequent updates were less critical.

Following a reviewer’s recommendation to use a shared drive, both Microsoft OneDrive and Google Drive were also employed for data storage and sharing of working files.
Plan we wniosku

All files will be versioned regularly and saved to appropriate folders stored on a computer. Additional secure copies will be made on the external hard drive on a weekly basis (or when saving the newest version) No files contain any sensitive data. Each folder will have its archive folder in case something goes wrong with the newest version.
Wykonanie

Microsoft OneDrive and Google Drive were also used for data storing and sharing.
Otherwise, there have been no changes

Plan we wniosku

The results of the analysis are going to be published in a monograph at the end of the project (Estiminated DOP 2023).

The intent is also to publish preliminary analyses of the result in conference proceedings. Some smaller entities of the project are to be considered for journal article submissions such as in the Journal of Cleaner Production (CitseScore 7.32; Impact factor 7.051 2-year period) and Tourism Management (CiteScore 8.2;
Impact factor 6.012 2-year period).

No data used in this study is confidential or sensitive and can be shared as such.
Wykonanie

The remaining results of the analysis will be included in the monograph, which is scheduled for submission in autumn 2024.

The publication list with exact venues is included in the report. One accepted manuscript has a one-year embargo. The submitted version is available on the Bridge of Knowledge platform, and the accepted manuscript (Johansson, 2024) will replace it after the embargo. 

Otherwise, there are no changes.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku

The goal of submitting the monograph in 2023 was not met. A significant challenge arose from the additional objective of assessing disclosure quality using the counter-accounting approach, based on a recommendation from a reviewer of the project application. This required an extensive technical understanding of emissions accounting and thorough cross-checking with 40 GRI components. Delays were also caused by changes in the PI’s PhD strategy, including shifts from a monograph to publications and back. Nevertheless, this iterative process and additional objective provided valuable insights and learning opportunities, ultimately strengthening the research.

The goal of submitting the monograph in 2023 was not met. A significant challenge arose from the additional objective of assessing disclosure quality using the counter-accounting approach, based on a recommendation from a reviewer of the project application. This required an extensive technical understanding of emissions accounting and thorough cross-checking with 40 GRI components. Delays were also caused by changes in the PI’s PhD strategy, including shifts from a monograph to publications and back. Nevertheless, this iterative process and additional objective provided valuable insights and learning opportunities, ultimately strengthening the research.
Plan we wniosku

The data used for this research will be extracted from Airline companies' annually published disclosures, which are available for all public. This extracted data will be categorized and entered SPSS and NVivo for quantitative and qualitative analyses.

As the collected and saved data during this project will not be very extensive in size, the newest versioned data files (e.g., files with sav. and nvp extension) can be stored by the researcher for multiple years after the research has ended for convenience reasons. This data can be used, for example, in longitudinal studies in the years to come. Selected data will be sent to Bridge of data and will be stored there for at least 10 years. The data provided in the repository will fulfill FAIR requirements and will be categorized and labelled according to the standard file formats.
Wykonanie

Numerical data was initially entered into Excel. Only data requiring more complex statistical analysis was imported from Excel into SPSS.

As intended, selected data has been sent to Bridge of Data. This dataset contains compiled and partially processed information on the major reporting instruments used by the industry, as well as topic-specific GRI and SDGs reported in the airlines’ FY19 reporting. The dataset is associated with Johansson’s (2022, 2024) quantitative research papers and can be found here: https://mostwiedzy.pl/pl/open-research-data/the-use-of-sustainability-reporting-instruments-in-the-global-airline-industry-in-financial-year-201,729125422722701-0 

The data selection for Bridge of Data is based on ensuring that only data associated with published relevant research is included. The .xlsx format was chosen to optimise the data’s potential use with various statistical software. As suggested in the application, the selected data can be used in longitudinal studies.

Additionally, as noted in the Scientific Report section, there are plans to submit one more journal article based on unpublished findings after the defence. Data related to the planned publication will be considered for addition to Bridge of Data after peer review and publication.
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku
Uzasadnienie wprowadzonych zmian w stosunku do planu we wniosku

The secondary data collected from the airline companies’ reports are done by the primary investigator.

All data is entered SPSS and NVivo by the principal investigator and double-checked by him. All files are versioned are saved and stored by the principal investigator.

Open Science Competence Center (pg.edu.pl/openscience) - established by Gdansk University of Technology will be responsible for DMP and data storage and dissemination. Project PI (Eljas Johansson) will be responsible for the procedures assessment and overall data quality. All processes will be consulted with the supervisor/mentor and/or others in advisory positions at the Gdansk University of Technology
